captions.text: No, babe. No... Actually could you just get me the heating pad, babe?

comments.text:

rather walk around with something inside you that hurts when you squat,

like a wet diper all day?﻿

comments.text:
I have to say...I feel like wine would be an awful idea.
I was recently out of the country and caught a parasite. I was extremely 
dehydrated after being sick for a month, and then mother nature struck.
Genuinely the most painful period I've ever had, because I was dehydrated. 
I was curled up in a painful ball with an ice pack most of the week.
Sure the wine would make you feel better at the time, but if you were 
dehydrated the next morning...oh no.﻿

heating pad are my lovers & let no one & nothing come between us ﻿

comments.author: Dulce Alvaro

comments.text:
I don't use tampons because they make my cramps worse. During my period, I 
pretty much am just constantly cramp-y for the first 3-4 days, but if I put 
in a tampon in, it turns into a full-on cramp. Every. Single. Time. I've 
heard people say you can't feel a tampon if it's inserted properly, but I 
can still feel it the entire time I'm wearing it. The cramp it causes 
generally goes away within 30 minutes of putting it in, but I can still 
feel it, especially when I sit down, or stand up from sitting, or move in 
general. Even if I ignore the cramps, there's still the constant ache in my 
lower back, the fatigue, the insomnia, the upset stomach that leads to a 
whole host of issues such as diarrhea, constipation, and gas. Yeah. I get 
gassy when I'm on my period. It's really annoying. Even though beans and 
broccoli are staple foods in my diet, I'm generally not prone to 
flatulence. Like, I might fart once every few days at most normally. But I 
almost make up for it when I'm on my period, and I feel like that's worse, 
because I can always tell by smell that I'm on my period, and I worry that 
it makes it glaringly obvious that I'm on my period. Please tell me I'm not 
the only one who gets like that.﻿
comments.author: Anna Ewing

comments.text:
+oswaldftw Brand-wise, I've only ever used O.B, but I have tried a couple

always use the smallest size available, and that will still be 
uncomfortable. Thanks for trying to help, though.

comments.author: Dani Stuart

comments.text:
Haha! This wasn't a portrayal of myself but I could still relate to some of 
the things here. I know like hell I'm not swimming or doing any sports 
during that time of the month. I don't really get irritable as I like to 
stay consistently up-beat in all things in life and thankfully, I only 
cramp on the first and maybe a little on the second day. I wouldn't ever 
push my guy away during that time but any major intimacy is a no. Kudos to 
any guy that doesn't mind sleeping with his girl during her period (I know 
some mention just using a towel) but any desire is pretty much killed for 
me as I feel kinda...dirty. Last thing I want is someone else getting close 
to me when I'm not feeling my freshest. If it weren't for the fear of a 
massive hormone imbalance, I'd have my eggs removed (I don't want 
children).﻿

comments.text:
It's actually quite comical how tampon commercials like to glorify periods 
and yet they actually barely have anything to do with a woman's menstrual 
cycle.  They never really have anything to do with the actual tampon itself 
and just show women in dresses dancing in circles.  Although I understand 
where they are going with it (you will feel comfortable if you wear these 
tampons and not worry about leaking, etc) it is still bothersome.  This 
further pushes this normal bodily function into something that should be 
kept to ones self and hidden.  Just something to ponder about.  ﻿

comments.author: Party girl

comments.text:
Okay, It annoys me when girls comment like "That's so me" or "I have 
periods and I'm not like that. Girls just need to get over it. Stop 
moping." Like, yes, maybe you don't, but some of us get them very painfully 
and it hurts to freaking breathe sometimes. I had that once, and while I'm 
thankful it has not happened again, I get why some girls don't like their 
period. I haven't had cramps since my first period, and I only get them 
when I'm hungry. 
When my friend is on her period, you can always tell because her hand is 
almost always on her stomach. She actually has a pass to not be able to do 
anything in Gym. She actually tries to play a bit of basketball and she 
walks around with me during that time, but you can tell it hurts a lot. And 
then me over here, I only get cramps if I'm hungry, and I can run around. I 
get it bad at times though. Sometimes I get so weak that I'm literally 
dragging my feet, but still no cramps.

Girls, we're all different. Chill out.﻿
comments.author: Singer Chick

comments.text:
If your menstruation causes symptoms that severe every month you should see 
a doctor. ﻿

comments.text: Am I the only one who doesn't get period pain?﻿
comments.author: Kitty Kraftin

comments.text:
My grandmother used to be violently ill and couldnt move at all and she'd 
do nothing but vomit and lay in bed for a week. But on the flip side I just 
get a bit crampy and feel kinda meh. It's a really diverse and no one 
should feel concerned about their period symptoms. (Unless you get 
excessive bleeding and I mean BAD like multiple pads a day then you should 
see about getting the pill to help regulate it.)﻿
